summary: Gaston transforms the traditional hotel dining experience into a lively French bistro nestled in Grand Hyatt Erawan Bangkok. With a casual ambiance and chef David Senia's engaging presence, the menu highlights comforting classics like steak frites and duck foie gras. This revamped space offers a refreshing alternative to Bangkok's fine dining scene, focusing on approachable French cuisine.

name: The Shoyu Stand
summary: Shoyu Stand offers a unique ramen experience crafted by Shin Inoue's protege, featuring signature dishes like the rich Cappuccino Noodles. Inspired by Japanese street vendors, this cozy spot in Thonglor invites diners to enjoy flavorful ramen in a comfortable setting. Despite the popularity and limited seating, the moderate prices make it accessible for both ramen enthusiasts and newcomers alike.

name: Bisou
summary: Bisou offers a refreshing departure from Bangkok's typical wine bars with its French-inspired sharing plates and a carefully curated wine list. The airy, modern decor features film posters and a unique oculus ceiling that enhances the dining experience. With standout dishes like celeriac truffle risotto and decadent dark chocolate souffle, this gastro wine bar promises both great meals and a vibrant atmosphere.

name: Crystal Grill House
summary: Crystal Grill House offers a unique dining experience within soundproof glass domes, providing privacy amidst the vibrancy of Asiatique. The menu features impressive dishes like grilled octopus and wagyu ribeye, complemented by refreshing signature cocktails. This steakhouse elevates riverside dining with its creative ambiance and delicious fare, making it worth a visit for both locals and tourists alike.

name: Nawa Central Thai Cuisine
summary: Nawa Central Thai Cuisine offers a refined dining experience where traditional Thai flavors meet contemporary presentation. The vibrant atmosphere, marked by dark walls and an open kitchen, creates a unique backdrop for an impressive 14-course tasting menu. Dishes like tom yum koong and wagyu panang highlight the chefs' expertise while maintaining comforting elements of Thai cuisine.

name: Rolling Ribs Brew Bar and BBQ
summary: Rolling Ribs Brew Bar and BBQ offers a unique Memphis-style barbecue experience right in Bangkok. Enjoy a cozy yet vibrant atmosphere, with both indoor and alfresco seating, while indulging in their All Star Combo Platter featuring an array of smoked meats. This casual smokehouse combines street food vibes with the comforts of a five-star hotel, making it a must-visit for barbecue lovers.

name: Mer Made Cantina
summary: Mer Made Cantina introduces a fresh take on gourmet tinned seafood in Ladprao, challenging the perception of canned food. This charming tapas spot features locally sourced delicacies and an evolving menu that promises a vibrant community atmosphere. With its focus on quality ingredients and unique offerings like natural wine sangria sorbet, it’s a must-visit for adventurous diners.

name: Fran's
summary: Fran's offers a cozy brunch experience in a stunning glasshouse setting, drawing both foodies and locals. Despite some inconsistencies in the menu, particularly with dishes like eggs benedict, its charm keeps visitors coming back. A long reservation wait speaks to its popularity as a must-visit spot in Bangkok.

name: Kiri Tsukemen
summary: Kiri Tsukemen specializes in tsukemen, offering freshly made noodles paired with rich dipping sauces served in a unique burning stone bowl. This compact spot allows diners to watch chefs craft their dishes right at the L-shaped counter bar. With hearty portions and a variety of flavors, it's sure to become a favorite for lunch or afterwork meals in Thonglor.

name: Yankii Robatayaki and Bar
summary: Yankii Robatayaki and Bar offers a lively fireside dining experience where guests can grill their own ingredients alongside a full bar. The vibrant atmosphere, inspired by 50s Dagashi shops, complements the deliciously crafted Japanese dishes and signature cocktails. While prices lean towards the higher side, the unique combination of drinks and grilled bites makes it an enticing spot for casual dining or after-work drinks.

name: No Name Noodle
summary: No Name Noodle, a trendy Bangkok eatery that opened in early 2022, has quickly gained a loyal following for its minimalist menu featuring just two standout dishes, including the acclaimed Tokusei clear shio soba with sous-vide pork chashu. The attentive staff enhance the dining experience by guiding patrons on how to savor each bite, while a 40-minute dining limit adds an exclusive touch. Don't miss their refreshing yuzu ice cream for dessert, and be sure to follow their Instagram for reservation updates!

name: Udon Sakaba Kitaro Labo
summary: Udon Sakaba Kitaro Labo offers a delightful escape with its thick udon noodles and premium sukiyaki featuring Okinawa's aguu pork. A cozy two-storey shophouse, it boasts traditional low tables on the first floor and private rooms upstairs for larger groups. Perfect for winding down after work, this spot serves Japanese beer daily to complement your meal.

name: Larb Siab
summary: Rooftop izakaya Larb Siab combines an artistic atmosphere with a unique Isaan twist on yakitori skewers. Indulge in bite-sized larb creations accompanied by craft beer while enjoying sunset views. Affordable prices and a chill vibe make this spot ideal for casual gatherings with friends.

name: Dosan Dalmatian
summary: Dosan Dalmatian offers a delightful fusion of Western and Korean brunch dishes in a whimsically decorated space. Enjoy photogenic desserts and signature drinks like their adorable Dalmatian chocolate while soaking in the view from the rooftop terrace. With a promise of late-night vibes and an upcoming wine menu, this spot is perfect for a relaxed outing in Siam Square.

name: Irie Bangkok
summary: Irie Bangkok combines the vibrant atmosphere of Jamaican dancehall with authentic jerk cuisine, just off Khaosan Road. With DJ nights featuring bass-heavy music and a menu of slow-cooked, marinated dishes, this venue delivers a unique dining experience. The grand opening on January 14 promises an exciting lineup headlined by Dub Pistols' Barry Ashworth.

name: Verde Cafe and Restaurant
summary: Verde Cafe and Restaurant offers a cozy atmosphere on Sukhumvit Soi, perfect for casual dining. The menu features a variety of dishes available through Grab for convenient delivery. Enjoy a local gem that combines quality with accessibility.

name: Sorellina
summary: Sorellina offers a fresh take on outdoor pizza dining, blending culinary expertise with innovative flavors. Signature dishes like the Soppressata pizza and burrata salad showcase unexpected combinations that elevate traditional ingredients. With a focus on quality and simplicity, this spot is set to impress pizza lovers in Sukhumvit.

name: Ang Morr
summary: Ang Morr attempts to elevate classic Chinese cuisine with visually stunning dishes like goldfish-shaped har gow dumplings. While the presentation is impressive, the flavors often disappoint and do not justify the high prices. A standout fried pork chop offers a glimpse of potential amidst inconsistent preparations.

name: Alpea
summary: Alpea, a bistro by renowned chef Arnaud Dunand, offers a cozy escape with rustic charm and fresh pastries. Comfort food is elevated here, featuring dishes like foie gras terrine and Cantal farmed pig that showcase high-level techniques. A grocery store below complements the dining experience with imported Savoie products, making each visit memorable.

name: Tsu Na Gu
summary: Tsu Na Gu offers a unique ramen experience in Ekkamai with only eight seats and a daily limit of 35 bowls. The rich tonkotsu broth pairs beautifully with melt-in-your-mouth char-siu from Kagoshima, making their special bowl a must-try. A cozy spot for ramen lovers seeking high-quality flavors in an intimate setting.

name: Fatboy Izakaya
summary: Fatboy Izakaya in Ekkamai offers a lively and modern twist on Japanese izakaya dining, featuring everything from wagyu maki to unique highball cocktails. The vibrant decor and atmosphere create an inviting space for socializing and enjoying delicious food with friends or family. Signature dishes like the tonkatsu pork chop and innovative drinks make it a must-visit for anyone looking to indulge in a fun night out.

name: Samlor
summary: Samlor redefines the Thai gap glaem experience with an inviting industrial vibe and a playlist that keeps the energy high. Expect creative twists on traditional dishes, like minced prawn ceviche and smoked pork ribs, alongside a fluffy Thai omelette with a molten yolk. Affordable prices and a focus on local ingredients make this spot a must-visit for food lovers seeking something fresh and stylish.

name: Juksunchae
summary: Juksunchae introduces a fresh take on Korean haute cuisine in Ruamrudee, blending traditional dishes with modern techniques. The restaurant features an 11-course experience that includes unique offerings like lobster jook and bibimbap with sea urchin custard. With its striking brutalist design and a selection of soju starting at B70, dining here is both a culinary and aesthetic delight.

name: Maison Dunand
summary: Maison Dunand offers a rustic, homey atmosphere reminiscent of French chalets, led by renowned chef Arnaud Dunand. With a Michelin star already in its first year, the menu features an exquisite eight-course experience highlighting fresh ingredients and creative flavors. A visit promises not only culinary delight but also a glimpse into the legacy of one of Bangkok's fine-dining legends.

name: Zao Larb
summary: Zao Larb elevates Isaan cuisine with adventurous dishes like fermented ox feet and raw beef delicacies in a stylish Thonglor setting. The thoughtfully designed space combines rustic elements with a modern twist, creating an inviting atmosphere. Daring eaters will appreciate the unique flavors that challenge traditional notions of northeastern Thai food.

name: Rongklanuea
summary: Rongklanuea is a hidden gem on a quiet street, serving up rich and hearty bowls of braised beef that have captured the hearts of foodies. The Emperor braised beef noodle features a delightful mix of cuts and toppings, making it a must-try for any meat lover. With limited seating and potential lines, visiting during off-peak hours is advisable to fully enjoy this culinary experience.

name: Sushi Saryu
summary: Sushi Saryu, helmed by renowned chef Seiji Sudo, offers an intimate omakase experience in a cave-like setting. The 15-course menu showcases exquisite dishes crafted from rare ingredients, including chutoro and Bafun sea urchin. A visit promises not only culinary delight but also a deeper appreciation for the art of sushi-making.

name: Côte by Mauro Colagreco
summary: Côte by Mauro Colagreco offers a sophisticated dining experience with Mediterranean-inspired dishes crafted by chef Davide Garavaglia. The restaurant's elegant design features floor-to-ceiling windows showcasing stunning views of the Chao Phraya River. A remarkable selection of grower champagne complements an innovative tasting menu that promises to delight every foodie.

name: Larder
summary: Larder offers a unique all-day dining experience in Phrom Phong with an industrial vibe and an open kitchen. The menu features house-made charcuterie and simple yet flavorful sandwiches, perfect for a casual lunch or afternoon work session. With plans for dinner service and natural wines by the glass, this spot promises to be a local gem worth revisiting.

name: Waanthai
summary: Waanthai, the latest venture by Michelin-starred chef Chumpol Jangprai, offers a casual yet photogenic setting for indulging in traditional Thai desserts. The menu features innovative creations like the Thai Mon Thong durian cheese cake and Taro Custard Mille-Feuille, showcasing regional ingredients with contemporary flair. A delightful high tea set and signature dishes make this cafe a must-visit destination in Thonglor.

name: Lava Asian Bistro and Bar
summary: Lava Asian Bistro and Bar offers a vibrant fusion of dining and nightlife, featuring live Thai singalongs and a DJ spinning nostalgic hits. The menu highlights easy-to-enjoy Asian dishes alongside expertly cooked steaks, complemented by signature cocktails and an accessible wine selection. Perfect for those who want to indulge in good food before dancing the night away, this spot is ideal for social gatherings.

name: Energy Station
summary: Located in Central World’s The Offices, Energy Station serves up grab-and-go bites and unique coffee blends sourced from local Thai farmers. Signature dishes include hearty sandwiches and crab super bowls, while evenings bring a selection of wines and beers. Indulge in chef Saki Hoshino’s ice creams for a sweet treat to complete your visit.

name: Embassy Room - Catalan Cuisine
summary: Embassy Room offers a unique Catalan dining experience in Bangkok, led by Chef Ferran Tadeo. The restaurant transforms from a breakfast venue into an elegant culinary stage, showcasing fresh Mediterranean ingredients and expertly crafted dishes. Highlights include the octopus pop a la catalana and an impressive selection of Spanish wines, promising a memorable meal that celebrates simplicity and flavor.

name: Lobster Main Kitchen
summary: Lobster Main Kitchen offers a cozy, intimate setting in Phrom Phong with a focus on comfort food at reasonable prices. While some dishes, like the beef tongue salad, shine, others fall short of expectations, leaving diners wanting more creativity and flavor. The desserts provide a sweet end to the meal, but overall, the experience feels average and uninspired.

name: Red Lobster
summary: Red Lobster brings a taste of Americana to Bangkok with its classic seafood dishes and signature Cheddar Bay Biscuits. Enjoy big plates of lobster and seafood, including the luxurious Signature Feast that features multiple delicacies. Located in the Queen Sirikit Convention, this spot promises a hearty dining experience for seafood lovers.

name: Mr Jogg's
summary: Located in the vibrant Chula area, Mr Jogg's serves up Indian and pan-Asian fast food in a casual setting. The restaurant features colorful decor and a menu offering chicken, prawns, and paneer dishes, though some flavors may need enhancement. Perfect for a quick bite amidst trendy shops, it combines convenience with an inviting atmosphere.

name: Gyukatsu Kyoto Katsugyu
summary: Gyukatsu Kyoto Katsugyu introduces a unique twist on the traditional tonkatsu by offering juicy medium rare beef cutlets. Located in the bustling Siam Center, this intimate eatery features high-quality cuts and a variety of condiments to customize your meal. With its limited seating and prime location, it's a must-visit for food lovers seeking a premium dining experience amidst the mall chaos.

name: Kavee
summary: Kavee redefines fine dining in Bangkok with a poetic approach to Thai cuisine, showcasing underappreciated ingredients. Chef Tae's 10-course experience features creative dishes like wild-caught frogs and winged-ants, transforming traditional flavors into unexpected delights. A contemporary setting complements the culinary artistry, making each visit a unique journey of taste.

name: Joy Dining Room
summary: Joy Dining Room offers a blend of grocery and dining experiences in a light, airy space adorned with soothing art. While some dishes like the firefly squid on linguine shine, others fall short of expectations, leaving mixed impressions overall. A well-curated wine list complements the inviting atmosphere, making it suitable for casual meetings or relaxed meals.

name: Vilas
summary: Vilas offers a modern twist on traditional Thai cuisine, creatively reinterpreting age-old recipes with global ingredients. Located in Mahanakhon Cube, the restaurant showcases local craftsmanship in its design, enhancing the dining experience. The 12-course menu, led by a talented Spanish chef, promises bold flavors and inventive presentations that challenge conventional Thai dining.

name: Taahra
summary: Charcoal grilling takes center stage at Taahra, where Thai street food classics are reimagined with flair. The bold interior contrasts with the unassuming exterior, and the chef's 13-course menu showcases innovative dishes that elevate traditional flavors. Seasonal rotations promise fresh surprises, making each visit a new culinary adventure.

name: Mott 32
summary: Mott 32 stands out as a premier Chinese restaurant in Bangkok, located within the swanky Mahanakhon. The intimate speakeasy-style dining rooms offer an inviting atmosphere while serving exquisite dishes like Peking duck and unique dim sum creations. Expect a blend of traditional flavors with modern flair, making each meal a memorable experience.

name: Sarnies
summary: Sarnies in Sukhumvit offers a cozy spot to enjoy comfort food with a Japanese twist, perfect for all-day lounging. Signature dishes include the smoked black angus short rib and unique pizzas like the Land of Milk & Honey. The zen-inspired interior complements an extensive alcohol menu, making it ideal for both work and leisure.

name: Acqua
summary: Acqua offers a luxurious dining experience in Bangkok, combining swank ambiance with attentive service. Chef Alessandro Frau presents a refined a la carte menu featuring dishes like ceviche of scallops and roasted quail atop foie gras. With an impressive wine selection and quality cuisine, this restaurant is ideal for special occasions despite its higher price point.

name: Koji-delic
summary: Koji-delic presents an intimate dining experience in a modern Nordic-inspired glasshouse, seating just eight guests. With a focus on koji and unique Japanese-Nordic fusion, the 10-course menu showcases locally sourced ingredients in creative ways. The dedication to innovative cuisine positions Koji-delic as a standout in Bangkok's evolving culinary scene.

name: Kimi Sushi Bar
summary: Kimi Sushi Bar presents an outdoor omakase experience that balances quality and affordability, perfect for newcomers. With a cozy atmosphere and rotating natural wines, this spot stands out in Bangkok's Thonglor area. Expect meticulous Edomae-style sushi served in three rounds, making each visit unique and delightful.

name: Villa Frantzén
summary: Swedish chef Björn Frantzén brings his Michelin-starred flair to Bangkok with Villa Frantzén, a stunning two-villa restaurant featuring modern Nordic cuisine infused with Asian flavors. Guests can indulge in an innovative 5-course tasting menu designed for shared experiences, complemented by unique cocktails inspired by Nordic and Asian ingredients. The lush garden setting and private dining options make it an ideal spot for memorable gatherings.

name: Buenazo
summary: Buenazo, a cozy new eatery in The Commons Thonglor, spotlights the vibrant flavors of Peruvian cuisine. With an open kitchen and sustainable decor made from sunken boats, it offers dishes like Classico Ceviche and Lomo Saltado crafted by chef Santiago Fernandez. A commitment to social responsibility and unique collaborations promises a delightful culinary experience worth returning for.

name: Lily Fu's
summary: Lily Fu's redefines the Soi 11 nightlife with its classy yet lively atmosphere, featuring a vibrant bar and DJs. The menu showcases inventive takes on classic Chinese and Southeast Asian dishes, with must-tries like the shrimp and truffle dumplings and a flavorful tomahawk steak. Don't miss out on unique cocktails like the Thai negroni, perfect for pairing with their creative desserts.

name: Guilty
summary: Guilty offers a lively twist on Peruvian cuisine with a vibrant atmosphere that invites guests to dance and enjoy surprise shots. Led by chef Carlos Rodriguez, the menu features innovative dishes like Toda La Vida Ceviche and grilled Hokkaido scallops, all paired with Latin-inspired cocktails. This casual dining experience transforms traditional hotel dining into a fun gathering spot for after-work crowds seeking something unique in Bangkok.

name: Fishmonger
summary: Fishmonger brings Thai seafood into the limelight with innovative fish and chips made from local catches. Nestled in Banthat Thong’s GalieOasis, this eatery offers a casual vibe with outdoor seating surrounded by greenery. Dishes like the beer-battered barracuda burger showcase the potential of lesser-known fish in a delicious way.

name: North
summary: Authentic Northern Thai flavors come to life at North, a fine-dining restaurant set in a charming colonial house. The 9-course experience features unique dishes that creatively incorporate lesser-known ingredients from the region. With its lush garden and thoughtful presentation, North offers a delightful culinary journey through Northern Thailand's rich heritage.

name: Jardin Du Boeuf
summary: Jardin Du Boeuf offers a fresh take on steak dining in Rama 9, focusing on ethically sourced ingredients and a vibrant atmosphere. Chef Don Sujith's menu features dry-aged beef from happy cattle and unique starters like Burnt Leeks cooked over an open flame. With spacious seating and a lively vibe, it's the perfect spot for friends to enjoy quality food and drink together.

name: Dukedon
summary: Dukedon elevates pla duk into a gourmet experience in the unassuming Soi Inthamara 31. The chefs employ Japanese techniques to enhance the fish's umami, offering dishes like grilled catfish with kabayaki glaze and torch-seared climbing perch. Reservations are highly recommended due to their meticulous sourcing and preparation process.

name: Nomada
summary: Nomada offers a vibrant beachside dining experience with sweeping sea views and breezy outdoor seating. Under the guidance of Chilean chef Andre Josef Nweh Severino, the restaurant showcases authentic South American flavors through seasonal ingredients and live-fire cooking. Signature dishes include calamares fritos and perfectly grilled picanha, making it a must-visit for food enthusiasts in Hua Hin.

name: 31 Degrees by Kad Kokoa
summary: 31 Degrees by Kad Kokoa offers a unique cacao-centric dining experience, crafted by chefs from the prestigious Bocuse d'Or Thailand. The menu features innovative dishes like oven-roasted free-range baby chicken with chocolate juice and decadent chocolate cocktails. This evolving bistro invites chocoholics to indulge in creative flavors that elevate traditional ingredients.

name: Samut
summary: Chef Thitid 'Ton' Tassanakajohn's latest venture, Samut, elevates local Thai seafood with a commitment to fresh coastal ingredients. The eight-course dining experience showcases Southern specialties in an elegant setting inspired by traditional Thai-Chinese decor. Anticipate a revamped menu soon, promising even more delightful dishes from the South.

name: The Deck Bangkok
summary: A Balinese oasis in Bangkok, The Deck invites guests to unwind amidst greenery while enjoying a diverse menu crafted by top culinary talents. Comfort food takes center stage with creative twists, such as Makhani Macaroni and hybrid pizzas. Family and dog-friendly, this evolving spot is perfect for leisurely afternoons with wine and innovative dishes.

name: Montagne
summary: Montagne stands out in Bangkok's ice cream scene with its artisan creations crafted by chef Bhupar Choonharas, a Sweet Chef competition winner. Unique flavors like Fleur de Benjamas and Ananas Shiso showcase a blend of tradition and innovation, while signature desserts elevate the experience. Mocktails curated by Supawit Muttarattana add a refreshing touch to this delightful dessert destination.

name: Tempered
summary: Tempered stands out in Bangkok's cacao scene, showcasing a dedication to Thai chocolate culture through unique single-origin drinks. The cozy space features delightful pastries, with highlights like the almond croissant and the Not a PBJ dessert. Future plans include expanding their offerings with a slow bar focused on diverse cacao beans.

name: Mother
summary: Mother offers a casual fine dining experience that celebrates local Thai ingredients with a thoughtful, straightforward approach. The earthy interior and open kitchen create an inviting atmosphere where each dish is crafted to highlight the essence of its components. With seasonal menus and innovative takes on traditional flavors, this restaurant promises a refreshing dining adventure in Bangkok's culinary scene.

name: Thaipas
summary: Thaipas merges Thai and Spanish culinary traditions in a charming tapas bar at Thonglor’s Seen Space 13. Signature dishes include wild mantis shrimp croquettes and a rich black paella, all made from local produce. The venue transforms into a seafood noodle shop during lunchtime, ensuring fresh offerings throughout the day.

name: Zao
summary: Zao in Pridi Soi 25 offers an authentic taste of Isaan, breaking away from the typical Bangkok adaptations. The café's modern design complements a menu rich with local ingredients, including unique dishes like fermented pla ra and spicy watermelon. Aiming to elevate Isaan cuisine, this spot is a must-visit for somtam enthusiasts seeking genuine flavors.

name: The White House Bangkok
summary: Culinary creativity shines at The White House Bangkok, where Latvian chef Alex Nasikailovs presents a theatrical fine-dining experience. Guests embark on a 10-course journey featuring visually stunning dishes and innovative cocktails crafted by ex-Salon Du Japonisant's Kei Sawada. This casual yet sophisticated venue promises an unforgettable exploration of flavors and presentations that challenge the norm.

name: Chutie is Baking
summary: Chutie is Baking offers a unique blend of artistry and pastry in Charoenkrung, showcasing seasonal treats crafted with passion. The inviting glass-enclosed kitchen allows visitors to witness the magic behind the delicious mayongchid tartlet and refreshing lemon posset. This charming spot transcends typical hipster cafes, focusing on quality over mere aesthetics.

name: Bendito Taco
summary: Bendito Taco in Thonglor offers an exciting twist on Mexican cuisine, featuring a Philly cheesesteak among its bold menu choices. With Oscar Perez Garcia at the helm, diners can enjoy top-quality beef and exceptional churros in a lively group-friendly setting. This airy venue is perfect for taco lovers looking to indulge without overspending.

name: Yummz Kulfi
summary: Yummz Kulfi stands out in Bangkok for offering a unique selection of creamy, no-churn Indian ice creams. With flavors ranging from classic chocolate almond to exotic saffron, there's a kulfi for every sweet tooth. Affordable prices and the option for delivery make it a delightful treat worth exploring.

name: Hippo Dough
summary: Hippo Dough on Sukhumvit Soi 31 is a paradise for donut lovers, boasting over 100 unique flavors crafted with European and Thai ingredients. Indulge in decadent toppings and creative twists, from classic Nutella to deluxe strawberry peanut butter and signature Giotto dark chocolate. Milkshakes and cheesecakes on a stick complement the offerings, making it a must-visit for dessert enthusiasts.

name: Ailati Resto
summary: Ailati Resto, just steps from BTS Saphan Taksin, offers a cozy Italian dining experience with a stylish ambiance perfect for Instagram. Chef Antonio Cuppaiolo crafts fresh pasta and pizza daily, featuring standout dishes like strozzapreti with salsiccia and seafood tagliolini. With an extensive pizza menu and delightful desserts, Ailati is a must-visit for Italian cuisine lovers.

name: Kate's Place - Supper Club
summary: A hidden gem in a stylish shophouse, Kate's Place offers an intimate dining experience with a monthly changing set menu featuring Thai comfort food. Signature dishes like beef panang and steamed red snapper highlight a blend of traditional flavors with a modern twist. Perfect for private gatherings, the space accommodates up to 12 guests, making it an exclusive culinary escape.

name: REES
summary: REES offers airport-goers an artisanal coffee experience with unique blends like the Fake-Off and Red Eye. Indulge in a variety of drinks, including refreshing Matcha Lattes and Yuzu Sodas, alongside grab-and-go snacks. A new counter bar will soon enhance this vibrant spot at Thailand's largest airport.

name: Antito
summary: Michelin-starred chef Amerigo Sesti brings a playful twist to authentic Italian cuisine at Antito. The vibrant decor and semi-open kitchen create an inviting atmosphere, perfect for enjoying dishes like prawn carpaccio and pizza fritta. Signature cocktails add to the experience, ensuring a memorable dining adventure without breaking the bank.

name: Kauai
summary: Kauai offers a refreshing take on healthy eating with its seasonally sourced meals and drinks, perfect for those on the go. Signature dishes like the dragon fruit smoothie bowl and princess wrap highlight a commitment to nutritious ingredients without sacrificing flavor. Owned by Thailand's Dusit group, this expanding mini-empire is ideal for anyone looking to eat well in a casual setting.

name: Sarnies Sourdough
summary: Sarnies Sourdough in Charoenkrung offers a delightful array of pastries and sourdough loaves made with sustainable flour. Signature bites like the cruffins and hearty salmon chowder bread bowl showcase their commitment to quality. With plans for an evening pizza menu alongside craft drinks, this bakery is set to become a neighborhood favorite.

name: Via Emilia
summary: Via Emilia offers a taste of Emilia Romagna in Sathorn, showcasing authentic ingredients like parmigiano reggiano and prosciutto di Parma. Signature dishes include the delicate passatelli soup and the flavorful tagliolini alla Scoglio, all crafted by experienced chefs. The restaurant's inviting atmosphere is perfect for indulging in classic Italian flavors with a modern twist.

name: Piccolo Vicolo
summary: Nestled in a Ratchathewi alley, Piccolo Vicolo exudes vintage charm while offering a fresh café experience. With its concrete interiors and eclectic furniture, this spot invites coffee lovers to explore specialty brews from around the world. Don't miss the delightful lemon tart or Basque cheesecake for a perfect sweet pairing.

name: Maze
summary: Maze offers a unique dining experience that intertwines bold Thai flavors with elegant design. Chef Phattanat “May” Thongthong crafts creative tasting menus inspired by her northern heritage, featuring innovative dishes like squid sai oua and ravioli khao soi. The restaurant stands out for its artistic approach to traditional cuisine, making it a must-visit for food enthusiasts.

name: Lahnyai Nusara
summary: Lahnyai Nusara offers a modern twist on cherished family recipes in an elegantly decorated space within Baan Turtle. Chef Thitid “Ton” Tassanakajohn presents tasting menus that feature innovative dishes like Hokkaido scallops and wagyu pad krapao, all infused with luxury touches such as truffles. Reservations are highly recommended to experience this intimate culinary journey.

name: El Willy Spanish Kitchen
summary: El Willy Spanish Kitchen introduces a vibrant dining experience to Bangkok, showcasing the charismatic flair of chef Guillermo Trullas Moreno. The cozy atmosphere features an open kitchen and colorful decor, perfect for enjoying family-style tapas like seafood paella and Basque cheesecake. A wine pairing option enhances the meal, making it an exciting culinary destination on Sukhumvit Soi 51.

name: Maison Bleue
summary: Maison Bleue offers a slice of Paris in Bangkok, showcasing warm vibes and decadent desserts. The menu features standout dishes like the pain perdu and rich duck confit, alongside a selection of tarts and pastries. Sip on specialty coffees or Mariage Freres teas in a charming setting adorned with lavender.

name: Drop by Dough
summary: Drop by Dough at EmQuartier elevates the donut experience with savory options like rosemary scrambled eggs and prosciutto sandwiches. Beyond sweets, diners can enjoy hearty dishes like roasted pork belly penne and crab salad donuts. A selection of drinks, including wine, complements this unique dining concept.

name: Citizen Tea Canteen of Nowhere
summary: Citizen Tea Canteen of Nowhere offers a unique tea experience in Bangkok's Talad Noi neighborhood, featuring locally sourced brews from various Thai provinces. With its artsy decor and meticulous brewing methods, this cozy spot empowers underdog culture while showcasing local handicrafts. Monthly specials keep the offerings fresh, inviting tea enthusiasts to return for new flavors.

name: CDGRE
summary: CDGRE offers a vibrant café experience at Siam Paragon, blending the talents of celebrity chefs with a unique European-inspired menu. The coffee bar serves expertly crafted drinks alongside dishes like wagyu tartare and German pastries, all within a stylish two-floor setting. Don't miss the curated streetwear selection that adds an extra layer of allure to your visit.

name: Ging Grai
summary: Ging Grai offers a culinary journey through four Thai regions in Chiang Mai's Nimman neighborhood, blending traditional flavors with an upscale twist. Highlights include seasonal grilled fish in banana leaf and papaya salad with field crabs, complemented by unique mocktails. The space also features a homeware shop showcasing local handicrafts, adding a creative touch to your dining experience.

name: Okonomi
summary: Okonomi, a Brooklyn-born gem on Sukhumvit Soi 38, features a minimalist design and a serene atmosphere. The menu centers around ichiju sansai, offering a balanced meal of one soup and three dishes curated by chef David Del Pilar Potes. Embrace the cashless experience while enjoying this unique dining concept in a charming mint-green house.

name: Potong
summary: Amid the vibrant chaos of Sampeng, Potong offers an innovative 20-course dinner that reimagines Thai-Chinese cuisine. Each dish is a sensory journey, from whimsical presentations like the orange tree dessert to expertly crafted cocktails in a unique opium bar setting. A carefully curated wine selection complements the culinary adventure, making every visit a reason to return.

name: BaanBan Cafe
summary: BaanBan Cafe in Siam Square One serves innovative Chinese pastries that have gained a loyal following. Signature items include their unique 'lava' pastries and dessert drinks that combine tea with khanom pia ice cream. A delightful treat for those seeking a sweet escape, this cafe promises an exciting twist on traditional flavors.

name: Waki Waki
summary: Waki Waki offers a unique vegan sushi experience in Bangkok, handcrafting creative rolls with premium plant-based ingredients. Diners can enjoy both vegetarian and vegan options at an attractive sushi bar with limited seating. The innovative flavors and textures make it a must-visit for sushi lovers seeking something different.

name: Son of Saigon
summary: Son of Saigon celebrates Vietnamese heritage through vibrant murals and a menu inspired by family recipes. Signature dishes like bánh mì and bún thịt nướng showcase fresh ingredients and traditional flavors, while drinks feature unique options like coconut freeze cold brew. This cafe offers a cozy atmosphere perfect for enjoying authentic Vietnamese coffee and cuisine.

name: Tokyo Neo
summary: Tokyo Neo reimagines the izakaya experience with a vibrant 80s retro vibe, featuring fun rolls and donburi bowls crafted by chef Goro Takatsu. Expect a delightful fusion of Japanese staples with Western influences, including signature dishes like crispy karaage and unique snacks. Currently offering delivery and takeaway, this eatery promises an exciting culinary adventure soon available for dine-in.

name: Smizzle Burger
summary: Smizzle Burger offers a vibrant diner experience with its playful ketchup-and-mustard decor. Indulge in their signature smash burgers made from locally sourced, hormone-free beef, with options like the Oklahoma and Crusty Blondy. Don't miss out on their decadent truffle fries and unique ice cream shakes to complete your meal.

name: Funky
summary: Funky brings the vibrant flavors of South America to Bangkok with its homemade arepas crafted by a Thai-Venezuelan duo. Each dish, like the classic Reina Pepiada and hearty Pelua, showcases meticulous preparation using quality ingredients. Vegan options ensure there's something for everyone, available for order via Line from 10am to 7pm daily.

name: Double Slash Rama 3
summary: Double Slash Rama 3 stands out with its sleek Streamline Moderne design and all-white aesthetic, drawing in cafe enthusiasts. Known for quality artisanal coffee, it offers unique drinks like the salted caramel cold brew and single-origin cacao coffee. Pair your beverage with delectable pastries such as ham and cheese croissants to complete the experience.

name: Bang Bang Burgers
summary: Bang Bang Burgers on Soi 11 redefines the burger experience in Bangkok with a vibrant dive bar aesthetic and an homage to pop culture. The menu offers a range of delicious burgers, including the classic Duke and unique Chicky Chicky Bang Bang, complemented by creative side dishes. Enjoy outdoor seating and look forward to a future selection of beers as dining regulations evolve.

name: Mil Toast House
summary: Mil Toast House transports Bangkok diners to Seoul with its charming bakery atmosphere and delectable offerings. Signature items include the souffle French toast and Bangkok-exclusive steamed Nutella brioche, alongside savory delights like ham and corn-stuffed buns. Family-friendly milk drinks in flavors such as Hershey Nutella add a sweet touch to this cozy spot.

name: Matcha Mood
summary: Matcha Mood embodies a contemporary space that celebrates the meditative essence of tea culture. Signature offerings include cold aged matcha and hojicha, both perfect for those seeking unique flavors. Pair your beverage with freshly baked madeleines for a delightful experience.

name: Scenema Café
summary: Discover Scenema Café in Samut Prakan, a nostalgic spot that celebrates the charm of old cinemas with its vintage decor. Indulge in unique drinks like popcorn lattes and savory bites inspired by movie snacks, all served in a whimsical setting. Capture memories at the photo booth or enjoy delivery via Lineman for a taste of cinematic fun at home.

name: Haru by Nana Coffee Roasters
summary: Haru by Nana Coffee Roasters embodies the essence of spring with its Japanese-inspired decor and a menu rich in flavor. The cafe offers an array of coffee, from classic brews to specialty drinks, crafted using both speed and slow bar techniques. Minimalistic interiors complement the vibrant coffee experience, making it a delightful spot for enthusiasts.

name: Bloom Pretzel and Coffee
summary: Tucked away in Pattanakarn, Bloom Pretzel and Coffee offers a unique twist on the classic German snack with freshly made soft pretzels. Choices range from sweet to savory fillings, including dark Belgian chocolate and cream cheese-stuffed options. The cafe's house coffee highlights local beans, ensuring a delightful pairing with their standout pretzels.

name: Sarnies Roastery
summary: Sarnies Roastery is set to expand its presence in Bangkok with a new location that boasts stunning pinewood interiors and lush greenery. Coffee lovers can look forward to an extensive selection of single-origin beans and unique blends, all crafted with care. The shop promises a visually appealing atmosphere perfect for capturing moments while enjoying high-quality coffee.

name: Rad Meats
summary: Rad Meats specializes in high-quality, additive-free sausages and cured meats crafted by chef Radek Zarebinski. Charcuterie platters offer a delightful selection perfect for home gatherings, featuring unique items like smoked duck prosciutto and locally sourced cheeses. Enjoy same-day delivery from Monday to Saturday, making it easy to elevate your dining experience.

name: Omi Tteok
summary: Omi Tteok offers a modern twist on traditional Korean rice cakes, known as tteok, in a sleek white and wood setting near MRT Ratchadapisek. Freshly made each morning, the cafe features unique flavors like creamy injeolmi and hearty tteokbokki served with various accompaniments. Pair your treats with refreshing yuzu sorbet or sugar-free roasted corn tea for a delightful experience.

name: Veganisto
summary: Veganisto offers a delightful selection of vegan ice creams made from coconut milk, providing a creamy treat without the guilt. Indulge in unique flavors like lemon cheese pie and banoffee pie, or revisit childhood with vanilla pecan Horlicks. Nationwide delivery is available via Line and Robinhood for those craving a sweet escape.

name: Qraft
summary: Qraft in Ari offers a unique take on the croissant, blending Japanese ingredients into flaky pastries that have quickly gained popularity. Specialties include miso caramel and a butterfly-shaped croissant waffle with diverse flavors. While walk-ins aren't accepted due to high demand, pre-ordering ensures you won't miss out on these delectable treats.

name: Hemp
summary: Hemp offers a unique twist on a classic treat with its CBD-infused ice cream, crafted from premium ingredients sourced from Thailand's Golden Triangle Group. Flavors like Northern Lights and Super Lemon Haze provide an indulgent experience that caters to both day and night cravings. Available for delivery, this ice cream promises a feel-good moment without the usual childhood associations of the dessert.

name: Aksorn
summary: Aksorn offers a unique culinary journey through forgotten Thai recipes, curated by renowned chef David Thompson. Nestled in Central: The Original Store, the restaurant's design pays homage to its mid-century bookstore heritage. Bold flavors and unusual dishes create an exciting dining experience unlike any other in Bangkok.

name: La Dotta
summary: La Dotta Silom offers a vibrant Italian dining experience with a modern twist, featuring fresh pasta made in-house. Signature dishes include deep-fried truffle and ricotta balls alongside rich tagliatelle bolognese, showcasing quality ingredients like wagyu and Parmigiano Reggiano. Monthly specials highlight unique pasta shapes, ensuring there's always something new to savor.

name: Hummus Bangkok
summary: Hummus Bangkok redefines Middle Eastern cuisine with a vegetarian focus and creative toppings. Enjoy unique pairings like hummus with avocado or roasted cauliflower, along with pita sandwiches and the delightful muhallebi for dessert. Order conveniently through delivery services like Grab Food and Foodpanda.

name: Tony’s
summary: Tony’s, helmed by chef Anthony Burd, elevates classic New York dining with a farm-to-table twist in a chic setting. The menu features nostalgic favorites like wood-fired pizzas and comforting pasta dishes, alongside a well-curated drink selection. Expect a vibrant atmosphere enhanced by an open kitchen and stylish decor reminiscent of upscale Italian eateries.

name: Rintaro
summary: Rintaro (Ari) offers a delightful selection of seasonal Japanese gelato with 18 unique flavors that change daily. Ingredients sourced from local farmers create enticing options like Chumphon cocoa with caramel nuts and Chiang Rai passion fruit. With affordable prices and a cozy atmosphere, this gelateria is perfect for sweet lovers looking to indulge in something special.

name: Potion Essential
summary: Potion Essential is a vibrant cafe in Sathorn that focuses on superfood-infused dishes designed to energize busy urban lifestyles. The colorful decor complements a menu filled with healthy options like quinoa salads and avocado toast, alongside refreshing homemade juices. With its emphasis on nutritious ingredients and eye-catching presentation, this spot is perfect for health-conscious cafe-hoppers.

name: Bangkok’s top 8 dog cafes
summary: Pet lovers will find joy at Bangkok's top dog cafes, where furry friends greet you in cozy settings. Enjoy high-quality coffee and unique pastries while interacting with over 50 dogs at Big Dog Cafe or visiting the charming dachshund cafe in Thonglor. Each venue offers a delightful experience for animal enthusiasts and coffee aficionados alike.

name: restaurants
summary: Ekkamai welcomes Somsak, a vibrant Thai eatery from the creators of Fatboy Izakaya, offering inventive dishes and cocktails with an Isaan flair. Chef Bank introduces Arloy in Silom, where traditional Thai cuisine meets American influences for a unique dining experience. These new spots are set to elevate Bangkok's culinary scene with their bold flavors and creative concepts.

name: Bangkok Art and Culture Centre
summary: Bangkok Art and Culture Centre serves as the city's premier contemporary arts hub, showcasing a vibrant mix of exhibitions and community programs. Featuring multi-level galleries and a public atrium, it hosts both established and emerging artists, making art accessible to all. Conveniently located next to BTS National Stadium, this venue is a must-visit for culture enthusiasts.

name: River City Bangkok
summary: River City Bangkok is a vibrant arts complex along the river that showcases curated exhibitions and a photography gallery. Regular art auctions and immersive digital showcases create a dynamic atmosphere, attracting both locals and visitors. With its modern setting and monthly rotating exhibitions, this destination embodies Charoenkrung's creative spirit.

name: The Warehouse 30
summary: Repurposed from WWII-era warehouses, The Warehouse 30 is a vibrant creative hub featuring galleries, design shops, and cafés. Rotating exhibitions celebrate contemporary art and craft within an industrial setting, making it a unique venue for cultural events. Located in the historic Charoenkrung area, it’s perfect for exploring nearby attractions like riverside galleries.

name: BANGKOK CITYCITY GALLERY
summary: BANGKOK CITYCITY GALLERY showcases ambitious exhibitions and experimental formats, making it a hub for contemporary art enthusiasts. The gallery emphasizes social practice and storytelling through diverse public programs that engage the community. Located off Naradhiwas–Sathorn, it regularly collaborates with regional festivals, enhancing its dynamic cultural footprint.

name: 100 Tonson Foundation
summary: 100 Tonson Foundation transforms from a gallery to a vibrant non-profit focused on Thai and regional contemporary art. Engaging exhibitions and critical dialogues are complemented by publications and talks that enhance accessibility to Southeast Asian art discourse. The foundation's commitment to collaboration and site-specific installations makes it a unique cultural hub in Bangkok.

name: NOVA CONTEMPORARY
summary: NOVA CONTEMPORARY showcases thought-provoking exhibitions by Thai and international artists, blending history with contemporary culture. The gallery emphasizes diverse mediums, including painting, sculpture, and installation, while fostering meaningful dialogue. Centrally located, it offers extensive archives and bilingual support for art enthusiasts and researchers alike.

name: SAC Gallery
summary: SAC Gallery stands out as a vibrant contemporary art venue on Sukhumvit 39, showcasing a diverse range of Thai and international artworks. With spacious galleries and an inviting sculpture court, it offers immersive exhibitions alongside educational programs. A café and design shop enhance the experience, making it a perfect stop for art lovers visiting Phrom Phong.

name: Number 1 Gallery
summary: Number 1 Gallery showcases contemporary art through large exhibitions featuring Thai and regional artists. Engaging in cross-cultural dialogues, it serves as a vital hub for collectors and art enthusiasts alike. With a focus on quality curated selections, this gallery is an essential stop during Bangkok's vibrant art seasons.

name: JWD Art Space
summary: JWD Art Space is a unique venue that combines top-tier exhibition halls with professional art storage and logistics. It hosts curated shows and educational programs, benefiting from its conservation-ready infrastructure. Located near Rama III, it plays a pivotal role in Bangkok's burgeoning art scene.

name: ATT 19
summary: A restored Sino-Siamese compound houses ATT 19, where contemporary art meets design and fashion. Exhibitions celebrate the layered architecture and rich neighborhood heritage, showcasing Thai and international artists. With curated retail corners and a café, this space invites leisurely exploration near the Creative District.

name: The Jam Factory
summary: A riverside creative campus designed by Duangrit Bunnag, The Jam Factory combines galleries, design shops, and eateries within a lush courtyard. This vibrant space hosts exhibitions, markets, and cultural events, attracting a design-savvy crowd. Positioned near ICONSIAM and accessible by ferry, it offers a relaxed atmosphere perfect for a cultural day out.

name: Gallery VER
summary: Gallery VER stands out as a hub for contemporary art, showcasing experimental exhibitions that provoke critical discussions. The space prioritizes engagement with social histories and supports both Thai and international artists through diverse practices. Its innovative approach extends beyond traditional formats, making it a vital part of Bangkok’s independent art scene.

name: YenakArt Villa
summary: YenakArt Villa offers a unique gallery experience within a converted modernist villa on Yen Akat Road. This intimate space hosts curated exhibitions of painting, sculpture, and installation by both Thai and international artists. Visitors can enjoy art in a serene setting that contrasts with Bangkok's bustling galleries.

name: Woof Pack Projects
summary: Woof Pack Projects serves as a vibrant creative hub near Lumpini Park, merging gallery spaces and indie cinema with dynamic event venues. This space fosters creativity through exhibitions, workshops, and festivals tailored for young artists and innovators. Its prime location allows visitors to seamlessly blend cultural experiences with leisurely park visits.

name: Kathmandu Photo Gallery
summary: Located in a charming restored shophouse, Kathmandu Photo Gallery showcases rotating photography exhibitions by both Thai and international artists. Renowned for its thoughtful curation, the gallery also features a specialty photobook shop and hosts occasional evening salons. Its intimate atmosphere makes it a must-visit for art lovers exploring the Silom area.

name: Chamchuri Art Gallery
summary: Chamchuri Art Gallery offers a vibrant space where student and professional artworks come together in curated exhibitions. Located centrally near Sam Yan and Siam, it serves as a hub for community engagement through art and workshops. The gallery's diverse programs make it an ideal spot for both academic exploration and cultural enjoyment.

name: Silpakorn University Art Centre
summary: Silpakorn University Art Centre showcases a blend of Thai art history and contemporary practices through exhibitions and public programs. Situated on the serene riverside Wang Thapra campus, it fosters an academic atmosphere that encourages dialogue between students and masters. Collaborations with national museums enhance its curatorial breadth, making it a vital part of Bangkok’s art scene.

name: Thailand Creative & Design Center
summary: Thailand Creative & Design Center (TCDC) serves as a vibrant hub for design enthusiasts, featuring extensive material libraries and co-working spaces. Temporary exhibitions showcase both Thai and international design history, making it a must-visit for creativity lovers. Engaging workshops and talks connect designers with industry innovations in the heart of Bangkok's Creative District.

name: La Lanta Fine Art
summary: La Lanta Fine Art showcases an impressive array of contemporary works by both Thai and international artists. The gallery's dynamic exhibitions, which include painting, sculpture, and installation, are complemented by engaging talks and catalogues. Accessible from central Bangkok, it offers a collector-focused experience with a commitment to supporting artists through special projects.

name: ARDEL Gallery of Modern Art
summary: ARDEL Gallery of Modern Art showcases a vibrant mix of established and emerging Thai artists through diverse exhibitions. The focus lies on printmaking, painting, and mixed media, often accompanied by workshops and artist talks. Located in western Bangkok, it emphasizes educational value alongside contemporary artistic practices.

name: Cartel Artspace
summary: Cartel Artspace showcases politically engaged exhibitions and performance programs, making it a vital part of Bangkok's contemporary art scene. With thematic cycles featuring collaborations that spark civic discourse, the venue invites thoughtful engagement from its visitors. Located conveniently near other galleries and cafés, it's an enriching stop for art enthusiasts.

name: MATDOT Art Center
summary: MATDOT Art Center serves as a vibrant hub for cross-disciplinary art in Bangkok's historic district. With its gallery halls and studios, it offers exhibitions and residencies that engage both local and international artists. Regularly updated events make it a must-visit for art enthusiasts looking to connect with the contemporary scene.

name: Kinjai Contemporary
summary: Kinjai Contemporary serves as a vibrant hub for contemporary art in the Bang Phlat area, featuring exhibitions that reflect social dialogues in Bangkok. The gallery emphasizes community engagement and supports emerging curators and artist collectives through accessible programming. Its proximity to the old town and riverside makes it a perfect stop for those exploring the city's heritage.

name: Kalwit Studio & Gallery
summary: Kalwit Studio & Gallery showcases contemporary art and mixed media by emerging Thai artists. Regular exhibitions are complemented by artist talks and community workshops, creating a vibrant cultural hub. Conveniently located near BTS Phloen Chit, it’s an ideal stop for art enthusiasts exploring the city.

name: Tang Contemporary Art
summary: Tang Contemporary Art in Bangkok showcases dynamic exhibitions by prominent Asian and international artists. Known for its critical projects and collaborations, the gallery offers a vibrant space that connects visitors to other art venues and riverside dining. Expect rotating presentations that align with the broader River City schedule.

name: Museum Siam
summary: Museum Siam offers an engaging exploration of Thai identity through interactive exhibits in a stunning neoclassical building. Multimedia theaters and hands-on displays create a dynamic experience for visitors of all ages, making it perfect for family outings. Its location near Wat Pho allows for easy integration into a day of cultural discovery along the riverside.

name: MOCA Bangkok
summary: MOCA Bangkok showcases a stunning collection of Thai modern and contemporary art across spacious, light-filled galleries. Visitors can explore works from national masters and emerging artists, alongside rotating exhibitions and educational programs. The museum's thoughtfully designed architecture complements its diverse offerings, making it a must-visit for art enthusiasts.

name: Jim Thompson House Museum
summary: A visit to the Jim Thompson House Museum offers an enchanting glimpse into traditional Thai architecture and art. Guided tours reveal a rich collection of Asian artifacts alongside the fascinating history of Jim Thompson and his silk revival efforts. The serene atmosphere, complemented by an adjacent café and boutique, makes it an ideal stop near BTS National Stadium.

name: Bangkok National Museum
summary: Explore Thailand's rich history at the Bangkok National Museum, where artifacts from prehistory to modern times await. Highlights include royal regalia and the revered Phra Buddha Si Hing, with multilingual guided tours enhancing the experience. Located next to Sanam Luang, this museum is a cultural gem near significant landmarks like the Grand Palace.

name: The National Gallery, Thailand
summary: Explore the National Gallery, showcasing a rich collection of Thai art from modernism to contemporary works within a historic complex. Rotating exhibitions highlight significant artists and movements, making each visit unique. Located near the National Museum, it’s perfect for art enthusiasts seeking a deeper cultural experience.

name: Queen Sirikit Museum of Textiles
summary: The Queen Sirikit Museum of Textiles showcases the rich heritage of royal dress and textile traditions from Thailand and Asia. Permanent exhibitions highlight court couture and weaving techniques, complemented by rotating temporary displays that enhance the educational experience. Most visitors enjoy this cultural gem alongside a tour of the Grand Palace complex.

name: Rattanakosin Exhibition Hall
summary: Explore the Rattanakosin era at this interactive museum featuring immersive galleries and multimedia theaters. Visitors can engage with themed rooms and hands-on stations, making it ideal for families and students alike. Conveniently located on Ratchadamnoen Klang Avenue, it's a perfect addition to Old Town itineraries.

name: Suan Pakkad Palace Museum
summary: Explore the enchanting Suan Pakkad Palace Museum, featuring eight traditional Thai houses filled with antiques and exquisite ceramics. The highlight is the Lacquer Pavilion, adorned with intricate 17th-century decorations that reflect aristocratic life. Nestled in landscaped gardens, this museum offers a serene escape into Thailand's rich decorative arts history.

name: Siriraj Medical Museum
summary: Siriraj Medical Museum offers a unique insight into the world of medicine through its diverse collections of pathology, anatomy, and forensic exhibits. Each gallery is designed to provide scientifically accurate yet accessible explanations, making it an educational experience for all ages. Located by the river, the museum invites visitors to explore its fascinating displays while enjoying ferry access from nearby piers.

name: King Prajadhipok Museum
summary: Explore the life and reign of King Rama VII at the King Prajadhipok Museum, housed in a beautifully restored heritage building. Interactive media and personal memorabilia enhance understanding of Thailand's constitutional history. Educational programs and special exhibits make this museum a must-visit for history enthusiasts.

name: Bangkokian Museum
summary: Step into the Bangkokian Museum to explore a fascinating glimpse of mid-20th-century domestic life in Thailand. A collection of teak houses showcases original furnishings and family memorabilia, creating an immersive experience from the 1930s to 1950s. Volunteer guides enhance your visit, making it a serene retreat amid the bustling business district.

name: Royal Thai Air Force Museum
summary: Explore the Royal Thai Air Force Museum in Don Mueang, where aviation history comes alive through a collection of historic aircraft and artifacts. Rare planes like the Tachikawa Ki‑36 are showcased both indoors and outdoors, making it a fascinating visit for families and aviation enthusiasts alike. Admission is generally free, with periodic restoration projects offering insight into the preservation of these remarkable machines.

name: National Museum of Royal Barges
summary: Preserving Thailand's regal heritage, the National Museum of Royal Barges showcases ceremonial vessels along the tranquil Bangkok Noi canal. Visitors can marvel at iconic barges like the Suphannahong while learning about their craftsmanship and royal significance. Accessed by boat or road, this museum offers a unique glimpse into royal traditions and seasonal activities.

name: Bank of Thailand Learning Center & Museum
summary: Explore the Bank of Thailand Learning Center, a transformed mint showcasing Thai currency and finance through engaging exhibitions. Free entry allows visitors to enjoy interactive displays and workshops throughout the year, all set against a scenic riverside backdrop near Rama VIII Bridge. With cafés and co-working spaces on-site, it's an ideal spot for learning and relaxation.

name: Science Centre for Education
summary: Experience the wonders of science at Bangkok's oldest planetarium, featuring interactive exhibits in astronomy and biology. Affordable ticketing makes it ideal for families and students alike, with scheduled shows in both Thai and English. Seasonal programs introduce new films and engaging workshops, perfect for school groups or casual visitors.

name: Children’s Discovery Museum
summary: Children’s Discovery Museum in Chatuchak offers a vibrant learning experience for kids with interactive exhibitions and outdoor play zones. Themed galleries cover science, the human body, and city-building, complemented by rotating workshops to engage young minds. Conveniently located near Mo Chit and Chatuchak Park, it's perfect for family outings.

name: Thailand Cultural Centre
summary: Thailand Cultural Centre serves as Bangkok's premier venue for orchestral concerts, opera, and dance performances. With exceptional acoustics and a commitment to cultural education, it hosts both national and international productions. Located in Huai Khwang, it's easily accessible via the MRT Thailand Cultural Centre station.

name: Thai National Theatre
summary: Experience the rich tapestry of traditional Thai performing arts at the National Theatre, where khon masked dances and classical music come to life. Set in a heritage venue near Sanam Luang, performances span a seasonal calendar with weekend matinees and evening shows. Pair your visit with the nearby Bangkok National Museum for a deeper cultural immersion.

name: Sala Chalermkrung Royal Theatre
summary: Sala Chalermkrung Royal Theatre is a stunning art-deco venue that brings the traditional khon masked dance to life. Lavish costumes and live music enhance narratives from the Ramakien, with bilingual surtitles available on select days. Located in Bangkok's Old Town, it serves as a cultural gem within heritage routes, perfect for an enriching experience.

name: KBank Siam Pic‑Ganesha
summary: KBank Siam Pic‑Ganesha is a contemporary performing-arts theatre located on the 7th floor of Siam Square One. It features flexible staging and state-of-the-art lighting and sound, making it an ideal venue for musicals and concerts. Direct BTS access and an efficient ticketing system enhance the experience for attendees in the vibrant Siam Square district.

name: Calypso Cabaret
summary: Experience the vibrant Calypso Cabaret, a hallmark of Bangkok's entertainment scene showcasing dazzling transgender performances. With a mix of pop medleys and cultural vignettes, each show captivates audiences in a family-friendly atmosphere. Set against the scenic riverside at Asiatique The Riverfront, it's an ideal complement to shopping and dining.

name: Mambo Cabaret Show
summary: Experience the vibrant Mambo Cabaret Show, a renowned performance featuring dazzling dance numbers and comedic skits by talented ladyboys. This lively spectacle offers multiple seating options and caters to international audiences with interactive pop medleys. Centrally located, it promises a memorable night filled with entertainment and glamour.

name: Golden Dome Cabaret Show
summary: Experience the dazzling Golden Dome Cabaret Show, where an hour-long transgender musical performance blends Thai cultural motifs with global pop hits. Elaborate stage sets and vibrant costumes create a captivating atmosphere in Ratchadaphisek. Perfect for first-time visitors, this cabaret is a must-see on Bangkok's entertainment circuit.

name: Rajadamnern Muay Thai Stadium
summary: Rajadamnern Muay Thai Stadium showcases the electrifying sport of Muay Thai with professional fights several nights a week. Modern enhancements like dynamic lighting and commentary elevate the traditional ringside experience, making it accessible to new fans. Located near the Democracy Monument, this historic venue offers various ticket options for an unforgettable night out.

name: Lumpinee Boxing Stadium

Weekly fight nights feature modern staging and a range of seating options from general admission to VIP ringside. Special events and international bouts add excitement to the schedule, making it a must-visit for sports enthusiasts.

Regular seasonal events and advanced screenings keep the programming fresh and exciting for film enthusiasts.

name: Yakiniku Great
summary: Omakase-style yakiniku at Yakiniku Great (Thonglor) offers a unique dining experience with staff grilling high-marbling wagyu right at your table. The meticulously crafted course menus elevate the meal, complemented by attentive tea service that enhances each dish. Enjoy a rhythm of sharing favorites in a setting designed for comfort and conversation.

name: Honmono Sushi
summary: Honmono Sushi at Central Embassy offers a satisfying dining experience with its seasonal specials and comfortable seating. The signature tonkotsu is a must-try, showcasing the essence of their house style. Quick service ensures your bowl arrives hot, making it ideal for a focused meal in just thirty minutes.

name: Sushi Hiro
summary: Sushi Hiro in Ratchayothin excels in precision and hospitality, ensuring each bite is a harmonious blend of temperature, texture, and seasoning. The ramen stands out with its perfectly springy noodles and glossy broth, complemented by customizable toppings for a personalized experience. Quick service and consistent quality make this spot perfect for a focused meal that brightens your day.

name: Sushi Den
summary: Sushi Den at Siam Paragon offers a meticulous dining experience where every detail from temperature to seasoning is finely tuned. The quick counter service ensures that each bowl arrives hot and consistently flavorful, making it ideal for a focused meal. Start with the signature tonkotsu to truly appreciate the restaurant's dedication to quality and craftsmanship.

name: Best Beef
summary: Best Beef (On Nut) offers a vibrant all-you-can-eat grill experience in a spacious open-air setting, perfect for sharing with friends. Regulars rave about the lively atmosphere and diverse menu featuring crunchy salads, hearty soups, and flavorful curries. Located near BTS On Nut, this restaurant attracts crowds after 7pm, making it ideal for a fun night out.

name: King Kong Buffet
summary: King Kong Buffet in Thonglor offers an all-you-can-eat yakiniku experience with a family-friendly atmosphere. The efficient service and clean smoke control enhance the enjoyment of sharing various Cantonese dishes, including dumplings and lacquered roasts. Weekend lunches come alive with rolling baskets, making it a festive dining adventure.

name: You & I Premium Suki
summary: Individual hotpot broths make You & I Premium Suki a standout dining experience, complemented by premium add-ons like wagyu and river prawns. The vibrant Thai flavors shine through fresh herbs and balanced heat, creating an exciting culinary journey. With a spacious location at Mega Bangna, this restaurant caters to both lively weekends and cozy weeknight gatherings.

name: Shabu De Bear
summary: Shabu De Bear (Rama 9) offers a playful dining experience with cartoon-bear branding and customizable shabu-shabu options. The inviting atmosphere is perfect for groups, allowing diners to explore a variety of flavors while enjoying carefully crafted coffee. With friendly portions and attentive service, this restaurant ensures a satisfying meal without feeling heavy.

name: Ssamthing Together
summary: Ssamthing Together in Ekkamai offers a refreshing take on modern Korean cuisine, moving beyond the typical BBQ experience. The atmosphere is lively yet relaxed, perfect for both quick coffee stops and leisurely meals with friends or family. With an emphasis on quality ingredients and careful preparation, each dish invites diners to savor the flavors without overwhelming them.

name: JinSeng Korean Restaurant
summary: JinSeng Korean Restaurant offers a cozy K-BBQ experience with charcoal grills and an array of generous banchan. The relaxed atmosphere encourages diners to savor each dish, from crunchy salads to flavorful curries. Coffee is brewed with care, ensuring a sweet finish without bitterness in the warm, acoustically-friendly setting.

name: The Tongkeungui — Late Night
summary: Late-night cravings find their match at The Tongkeungui, where marinated short ribs and cold noodles take center stage. A blend of Cantonese flavors shines through with thin-skinned dumplings and lacquered roasts, all served with attentive tea service. The ambiance fosters easy conversations, making it a perfect spot for both festive weekends and composed weekdays.

name: Mapo Galbi
summary: Mapo Galbi in Sukhumvit 31 offers a vibrant dining experience with its tabletop grills featuring spicy marinades and refreshing kimchi stews. Customers appreciate the efficient service and relaxed atmosphere, making it ideal for both quick meals and casual catch-ups. The thoughtful coffee selection enhances the overall experience, showcasing sweet notes without bitterness.

name: Seoulchon
summary: Seoulchon (Saphan Khwai) offers a vibrant K-street food experience with cheesy tteokbokki and crispy fried chicken. The neon-trimmed decor complements the casual vibe, providing a welcoming atmosphere where first-timers receive helpful service. Regulars enjoy a well-curated selection of dishes that balance flavors and textures, ensuring each visit feels fresh yet familiar.

name: Bonchon
summary: Bonchon (IconSiam) offers a vibrant dining experience where Thai flavors meet attentive service. The inviting atmosphere encourages guests to linger over expertly brewed coffee and flavorful dishes infused with herbs and lime. A perfect spot for both quick meals and relaxed hangouts, each visit promises a delightful journey of taste.

name: L’Oliva Ristorante & Pizzeria
summary: L’Oliva Ristorante & Pizzeria offers a taste of Abruzzo with its wood-oven pizzas and olive oil-forward dishes. The garden patio seating creates a cozy atmosphere, perfect for savoring seasonal picks without pressure. Enjoy conversations in a warm, tactile setting that invites relaxation and comfort.

name: Ciao Pizza
summary: Ciao Pizza (Ari) offers a warm, family-friendly atmosphere with expertly crafted pizzas featuring light leavening and balanced toppings. The inviting decor enhances conversation, making it an ideal spot for relaxed dining. Seasonal recommendations from staff keep the experience refreshing and grounded without feeling heavy.

name: Pala Pizza Romana
summary: Dine at Pala Pizza Romana while enjoying stunning skyline views as the sun sets over Bangkok. The menu features fresh, citrusy cocktails and dishes that enhance the vibrant atmosphere. Smart-casual attire is recommended, making it a perfect spot for a stylish evening out.

name: Il Bolognese
summary: Il Bolognese (Sathorn) offers a delightful experience with hand-rolled pasta and Emilia-Romagna classics in a cozy, brick-lined dining room. The menu features thoughtfully crafted dishes that emphasize comfort without excess, making each meal feel satisfying yet light. A well-curated wine cellar complements the food, providing options for every palate without overwhelming choices.

name: Scarlett Wine Bar Kitchen — Bistro Plates
summary: Scarlett Wine Bar Kitchen offers a cozy rooftop bistro experience featuring expertly crafted charcuterie and steak-frites. The relaxed atmosphere is complemented by an extensive wine list, with seasonal picks recommended by attentive staff. Enjoy comfort food that emphasizes restraint in flavor, making every dish a delight without overwhelming the senses.

name: Medici Kitchen & Bar — Trattoria Night
summary: Experience an intimate evening at Medici Kitchen & Bar, where live performances enhance the moody ambiance. Delight in Tuscan-inspired comfort dishes crafted with restraint and served with polished hotel-level service. The warm atmosphere invites relaxed conversation, making it perfect for a memorable dining experience.

name: Giglio Trattoria Fiorentina
summary: Giglio Trattoria Fiorentina offers a vibrant twist on Tuscan cuisine, featuring the standout bistecca alla fiorentina. The compact, neighborly space encourages sharing and experimentation with Thai-inspired flavors that tantalize the palate. With attentive service guiding your culinary journey, each dish bursts with freshness and warmth, making for an engaging dining experience.

name: Via Emilia
summary: Via Emilia offers an authentic taste of Romagna, featuring dishes like piadina and ragù in a relaxed atmosphere. With attentive staff guiding diners toward seasonal selections, each meal feels effortless and satisfying. The focus on restraint in flavors ensures comfort without heaviness, making it a delightful dining experience.

name: Enoteca Italiana
summary: Enoteca Italiana offers an intimate dining experience with expertly crafted tasting menus in a warm and inviting cellar. The restaurant's atmosphere encourages leisurely conversation, enhanced by knowledgeable pairing advice and a focus on restraint in its dishes. A perfect spot for those seeking comfort food that delights without overwhelming, making it a memorable culinary retreat.

name: Appia
summary: Roman-style porchetta and expertly crafted pastas shine in a lively, cozy setting at Appia. This restaurant balances traditional Italian flavors with a vibrant Thai twist, making every dish an exciting experience. Friendly service ensures first-timers feel welcome while sharing plates encourages tasting a variety of delightful dishes.

name: Factory Coffee
summary: Factory Coffee in Suan Phlu boasts a competition-winning roastery team and a rotating filter menu featuring microlots. The menu invites sharing with vibrant dishes like crunchy salads, smoky grills, and flavorful curries, perfect for groups. Service is friendly and informative, making it an ideal spot for both first-timers and regulars seeking a lively dining experience.

name: Ekkamai Macchiato — Home Brewer
summary: Coffee is treated as a craft at Ekkamai Macchiato — Home Brewer, where sweet extractions and a relaxed atmosphere invite patrons to linger. The inviting space offers ample seating bathed in soft light, ideal for both quick stops and longer stays with laptops or books. With a thoughtful approach to coffee and an accommodating menu for non-coffee drinkers, this café is perfect for any time of day.

name: Kaizen Coffee Co.
summary: Kaizen Coffee Co. (Ari) embraces coffee as an art form, showcasing sweet extractions in a relaxed atmosphere. The menu features vibrant Thai dishes perfect for sharing, with a focus on fresh herbs and balanced spice levels. Weekends buzz with families and food enthusiasts, making it a lively spot to explore diverse flavors together.

name: Omotesando Koffee
summary: Omotesando Koffee (EmQuartier) elevates coffee to an art form, showcasing meticulous brewing techniques that highlight sweetness without bitterness. Seasonal pastries complement the menu, enticing regulars with both staples and unique specials. Ideal for a quick caffeine fix or a leisurely read, the inviting atmosphere encourages guests to linger and savor their experience.

name: % Arabica
summary: % Arabica at Siam Paragon offers a crafted coffee experience with sweet extractions and a relaxed atmosphere. Ideal for both quick stops and leisurely afternoons, it features a cozy environment perfect for light lunches or catching up over a laptop. Non-coffee drinkers can also indulge in an array of teas and sodas, ensuring there's something for everyone.

name: Starbucks Reserve Chao Phraya Riverfront
summary: Coffee is treated as an art form at Starbucks Reserve Chao Phraya Riverfront, where each cup is crafted with precision for a sweet, unbitterness experience. The inviting atmosphere encourages both quick visits and leisurely afternoons spent with laptops or friends. Seasonal pastries add a delightful twist, making it an ideal spot for coffee enthusiasts and casual diners alike.

name: After You Dessert Café
summary: After You Dessert Café at Siam Square One is a haven for dessert lovers, famous for its Shibuya Honey Toast that balances crisp edges with a soft center. The café's atmosphere transitions from an efficient morning stop to a cozy afternoon retreat, perfect for light lunches or catching up over coffee. Seasonal menus and expertly crafted beverages ensure there's always something new to try, appealing to both coffee aficionados and non-coffee drinkers alike.

name: Cheevit Cheeva
summary: Cheevit Cheeva in Thonglor offers a delightful dessert experience focused on texture and shareable portions. The tea service complements each dish, creating a comfortable atmosphere for easy conversation. Weekend lunches are festive with an array of treats, while weekdays maintain a composed efficiency.

name: Mont Nom Sod
summary: Mont Nom Sod at MBK Center offers a delightful dessert experience with shareable portions that encourage sampling. The bright and cheerful atmosphere makes it an inviting stop after dinner, while the playful menu features seasonal twists on nostalgic favorites. Desserts here balance texture and flavor, ensuring each visit is as enjoyable as the last.

name: Thong Yoy Café
summary: Thong Yoy Café at ICONSIAM celebrates coffee as an art form, offering a relaxed atmosphere perfect for sharing meals. Unhurried service ensures that each dish is paired thoughtfully with tea, enhancing the dining experience. Weekend lunches bring a festive spirit, while weekdays offer a more composed setting for efficient enjoyment.

name: Sirocco
summary: Sirocco, perched on the 63rd floor of State Tower, offers breathtaking skyline views along with a Mediterranean-inspired seafood menu. The terrace is perfect for golden hour, where fresh cocktails complement the vibrant atmosphere. Smart-casual attire enhances the experience as flavors and visuals beautifully align against Bangkok's neon backdrop.

name: Cielo Sky Bar & Restaurant
summary: Cielo Sky Bar & Restaurant offers a stunning skyline view paired with meticulously timed culinary courses. Fresh and citrusy cocktails complement the elevated dining experience, especially during golden hour. Expect smooth service and flavors that resonate with the vibrant Bangkok backdrop.

name: Blue Sky
summary: Blue Sky at Centara Grand offers a remarkable dining experience with stunning skyline views that complement each dish. The kitchen expertly times courses, ensuring flavors are as vibrant as the surroundings. Enjoy fresh, citrusy cocktails in a smart-casual setting that enhances both taste and atmosphere.

name: Red Sky — Chef’s Seasonal Menu
summary: A dining experience at Red Sky offers spectacular skyline views paired with a seasonal menu that enhances each moment. As golden hour approaches, the ambiance shifts from warm gold to vibrant neon, perfectly complementing the dishes. Service is attentive and smart-casual attire is recommended for this memorable outing.

name: Spectrum Dining
summary: Spectrum Dining at Hyatt Regency Sukhumvit pairs stunning skyline views with expertly timed culinary courses. Fresh, citrusy cocktails complement the atmosphere as Bangkok transitions from golden hour to neon. Smart-casual attire enhances the experience, ensuring a seamless service from start to finish.

name: Biscotti — Chef’s Counter
summary: Biscotti at Anantara Siam offers a dynamic dining experience where seasonal flavors take center stage. A thoughtful selection of dishes, from crunchy salads to comforting curries, ensures there's something for every palate. Coffee enthusiasts will appreciate the meticulous brewing process that highlights sweetness without bitterness.
